main_definition: Refurbished refers to an item, especially electronics or furniture, that has been cleaned, repaired, or restored to a good condition after being previously used.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To restore something (like an old piece of furniture) back to its original appearance or better condition by repairing and cleaning it.
meanings_and_examples.example: The vintage couch was refurbished, giving it a fresh look while retaining its classic charm.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Reconditioned electronic devices that have been fixed up and are ready for use after being previously owned or operated.
meanings_and_examples.example: He purchased a refurbished laptop which was pre-owned but fully functional, saving him money while still getting high performance.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Items that have been cleaned, restored to good condition, and may come with limited warranty or return policy.
meanings_and_examples.example: The store sold refurbished smartphones at a discount, ensuring they met quality standards while also offering a guarantee.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In the context of used cars, it refers to vehicles that have been restored and cleaned up after being previously owned.
meanings_and_examples.example: The dealership specialized in selling refurbished cars which had undergone extensive repairs to be roadworthy.
